title: Quality Improvement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at TMF Health Quality Institute
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with someone who was on an entirely different project than I was placed on. The information conveyed to me didn’t line up with the project I was placed on.
Interview Questions: To rank my knowledge of different subject matter areas, 1-5.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at TMF Health Quality Institute
Interview Descriptions: They called me and it was a phone screen trying to figure out your experience with different programming languages and large data sets. Next call they said would be more in depth about projects but weren't interested in details on phone screening.
Interview Questions: What was the biggest data set you have worked with?

title: Prefer Not To Say Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at TMF Health Quality Institute (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: It took a month to receive an interview email. It was taking about half hour, asked a lot of questions related to the reason for applying for this position, your career expectation, etc

title: Quality Improvement Coordinator I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at TMF Health Quality Institute (Austin, TX) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and I was called by a recruiter on the same day that I applied.  We played phone tag for a few days before we scheduled a phone screen.  The phone screen was a little more in-depth than a regular phone screening, but I was overqualified for this position in regards to the initial selection criteria and I was able to easily answer the questions.  I found the recruiter to be cold and rude.  She kept cutting me off and was very short with me.  By the end of the screening, I felt like I had to be concise because she was disinterested in hearing my answers.  It's hard to sell yourself if the recruiter is trying to push you off the phone.
Interview Questions: How have you used research in your work life to investigate an issue for management?

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at TMF Health Quality Institute (Austin, TX) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with HR recruiter, I then was invited to an in-person interview with hiring manager and a few team members. All went fine. I was told that I would hear back within a week. I did not her back. I sent an email inquiry, I then was told that decision will be made next week. I did not hear anything next week. I waited two weeks, I received nothing. Very unprofessional and lousy HR handling of communication, which indicates this is a lousy place to work for.
Interview Questions: Typical Project management questions about managing scope, time and budget

title: Health Quality Consultant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at TMF Health Quality Institute (Austin, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: My first interview was with a recruiter.  The recruiter then scheduled a second interview with the project manager. All interviews were done via phone due to the remote position I applied for.  I researched the company and role of HQI consultant prior to the phone interview.
Interview Questions: What makes you a great fit for this position?

title: Quality Improvent Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at TMF Health Quality Institute (Austin, TX) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: There is a two to three step process for hiring.  I was very impressed by the original recruiters knowledge about the position to which I was applying.  The recruiter will contact you and ask general knowledge question about the task area to which you have applied.  If you have the experience or knowledge they will pass you to the second phase which is the project lead.  Instead of the project lead, I was interviewed by peers because that position was not filled.  In my experience I had a third interview with the Project Director because our team was in the process of hiring new staff.
Interview Questions: How comfortable am I educating physicians as a non-clinician.

title: Quality Improvement Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at TMF Health Quality Institute (San Marcos, TX)
Interview Descriptions:
Initial phone interview was professional, and a very detailed questioning of terminology and my knowledge regarding the industry and position.  

In person interview was located at the office.  The interviewer gave me great instructions/directions to the office.  Questions were great and based on experience and skill set for the position.  Everyone was professional and polite.  

Good experience overall.
Interview Questions: Please share your experience working with providers or community partners.

title: Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at TMF Health Quality Institute (Austin, TX) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: HR uses contractors because they can't get people through the regular process. It takes a long time to process interview and very inconsistent. It is different for every candidate. Some people will interview faster than another. I felt like there was a discrimination per individual. Sadly, some employers feel they have the right (or even the need) to behave badly in the workplace, hurting and demoralizing the very people whose best thinking and assistance they need. Employees aren’t off the hook, either—many of the things that escape their lips in a moment of frustration damage their value to the company and their own career growth over time.
Interview Questions: How do you work under different supervisors?

title: QIC-I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at TMF Health Quality Institute (Austin, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Video interview. Not many questions. They wanted to know about my previous work with CMS and if i had experience with contract writing and if I was willing to learn about contract writing in this position.
Interview Questions: Simple questions about my resume and work experience.

title: Medical Policy Nurse Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at TMF Health Quality Institute
